Categories.Name: Tools
Categories.Description: General online tools that are useful for various things tasks; most are free to some extent.

Categories.Name: Games Dev
Categories.Description: Learning material and/or sources for games development.

Categories.Name: Ukraine
Categories.Description: Commentators and other content to help keep up to date with the Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

Tools.Name: World Anvil
Tools.Description: A tool with a free tier, allowing users to document their diverse worlds in as much detail as they fancy. I'm using it to build my "Perversion of Victory" world.

Tools.Name: Codepen
Tools.Description: Allows users to sandbox their web development ideas, and browse other developer's implementations for inspiration.

Tools.Name: Codecks
Tools.Description: A kanban baord-style application intended to make the process easier and prettier. I use it for many of my projects, though perhaps not as much as I should.

Games Dev.Name: Git Amend
Games Dev.Description: Covers intermediate and advanced concepts within the Unity game engine.

Games Dev.Name: Game AI Pro
Games Dev.Description: Steve Rabin's books on AI in games, free to everyone.

Games Dev.Name: NotPresident35's Content Curation
Games Dev.Description: A huge curation of sources for wide variety of topics around games development, many of which are engine-agnostic.

Ukraine.Name: Institute for the Study of War
Ukraine.Description: Analytical coverage of Putin's war of conquest in Ukraine.

Ukraine.Name: Jake Broe
Ukraine.Description: A (mostly political) commentator on the war in Ukraine from Las Vegas, USA. Tends to focus on the political side, be it his presidents' administration's stance; Europe's telegraphing; or Russia's rhetoric.

Ukraine.Name: Denys Davydov
Ukraine.Description: A Ukrainian himself, Denys covers the day-to-day military antics on the territory of Russia and Ukraine, with some political analysis.

Ukraine.Name: Ukraine Matters
Ukraine.Description: A dual-meaning name, covering matters happening within Ukraine, and spreading the message that the fate of Ukraine matters to us all. Analysis by Georgie of Denmark.

Ukraine.Name: DeepState Map
Ukraine.Description: A map, that's usually a few days behind reports, showing estimated control of territory based on many publicly avialable sources. These sources include reports from soldiers, civilians, press, drone footage, etc.
